intro: Corsia cornuta, commonly known as the horned corsia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its striking, horn-shaped inflorescences. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with opposite, elliptical leaves. Its flowers are usually small and white or pale yellow, clustered in dense, branched spikes. Corsia cornuta is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique and eye-catching floral display.
